Key Match Events: Kyle Schwarber stayed scorching hot going 2-for-3 with a leadoff HR.
Cristopher Sanchez allowed two runs over seven quality innings.
Kody Clemens's two-run homer lifted the Philadelphia Phillies to a 4-2 win.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Alejandro Kirk had back-to-back RBI doubles in the first inning for a brief Toronto lead.
Kyle Schwarber led off the first inning with a home run for Philadelphia.
J.T. Realmuto added a home run in the ninth that helped seal the Phillies' fourth consecutive win.
Schwarber launched a 92.9 m.p.h. four-seam fastball to the second deck in right field at Rogers Centre.
Clemens hit his fourth homer of the season to deep right field, driving in Brandon Marsh.
Realmuto tacked on another run in the ninth with his 12th homer of the year.
Post-Match Reflections: Bryce Harper expressed excitement about Kyle Schwarber's performance.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson commented on Bryce Harper's condition after being hit by a pitch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bryce Harper left the game after the first inning with a left elbow contusion.
